A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The path to redemption\, the journey of conflict\, and the unfortunate misunderstandings\, all make some of the best most emotional scenes of this movie. I am of course talking about the dynamic between Rey and Kylo Ren; Ryan Johnson did a solid one here. 
It didn't feel like a rehash of the empire strikes back\, but it's still undeniably Star Wars. 
All the other scenes and minor plot lines were just as entertaining and inciting as the rest of the 'main' storyline. 
That being said\, this movie did lack a little bit in terms of CGI; all of the new creatures looked incredibly fake\, where as I believe that the Force Awakens did a much better job on that part. Every moment that Snoke was onscreen he felt anything but real to me\, and Yoda\, despite being a puppet (probably) still had CGI effects added on him that made him look... smoother than intended I guess? It took me out of the story a little bit when I saw majority of these cool new creatures and immediately I'm thinking\, "Come on\, that looks so fake..." 
Otherwise it was a fantastic movie that I enjoyed the hell out of\, and I can't wait to see what the bring us in the future.
